intro: Seseli montanum subsp. polyphyllum, commonly known as mountain seseli, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is native to the mountainous regions of Europe and parts of Asia. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
